title: Canoe Ridge 2016 The Expedition Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine is mostly Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Aromas of blueberry pie and huckleberry pop, showing grace notes of barrel spice and herb. The flavors are lighter in style, losing concentration in the middle and seeming watery, and never come back together.

title: Château Moulin Saint-Georges 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. This is a simple wine, full of attractive berry fruits backed by gentle tannins. It has lively acidity as well as a soft texture, it will be ready to drink soon.

title: Château de Portets 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. An attractively fruity wine, this is brimming with black currant flavors and fine acidity. Its light structure with plenty of great fruitiness suggests that it will be ready to drink soon, certainly from 2020.

title: Vieux Château Gaubert 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. This is a juicy wine, very fruity and lightly textured. Its acidity and crispness are balanced by the soft core where tannins give a light sense of structure.

title: Château L'Argilus du Roi 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: This small, 12-acre estate was created in the 1990s. With plenty of juicy Merlot in the blend, this wine is ripe, lightly wooded and has good fruity balance. The contrast with the Saint-Estèphe structure gives the wine density and will let it age. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Lestage Chevillon 2015  Médoc
description: Ripe, fruity and with a layer of firm tannins, this wine has a good future. Its smoky tannins and black-currant fruits are developing well, giving a full wine, rich and ready to drink from 2022.

title: Château Pontet Barrail 2015  Médoc
description: Ripe with black fruits and balanced tannins, this is fast developing into an attractive wine. Its structure and tannins leave room for the juicy berry fruits and acidity, allowing the wine to be drinkable from 2022.

title: Château Tourteyron 2015  Médoc
description: This soft, juicy wine has ripe black-currant fruits and some smoky tannins. It is warm, generous and likely to mature quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Conti Zecca 2016 Donna Marzia Primitivo (Puglia)
description: Fresh red- and black-berry aromas are underscored by tilled earth on the nose. The palate is similar in character, boasting a ripe and juicy feel, with medium weight, light tannins and soft acidity. Drink now.

title: Cyan 2014 Valdefinjas Crianza  (Toro)
description: Murky, gamy aromas indicate that 2014's wet, humid conditions affected this wine. In the mouth, this is heavy and tough, with grating tannins. Black-fruit flavors combined with lemony oak are chunky, massive and acidic on the finish. This wine is good but has balance issues.

title: Deetlefs 2015 Chenin Blanc (Breedekloof)
description: Fresh apple, orange and green melon are at the fore of this straightforward yet refreshing and tasty wine. It is light in weight and concentration, offering fruity flavors of apple and pear that finish bright and clean. Drink now.

title: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. Juicy, soft and fruity, this is an easy wine, full of great fruitiness and crisp acidity. Drink early to enjoy its refreshment.

title: Château Brillette 2017 Barrel Sample  (Moulis-en-Médoc)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. This is a tight wine, crisp with a sense of heavy extraction. It is dominated by its acidity as much as by fruit at this stage, and will need plenty of time to soften. Drink from 2023.

title: Airlie 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Fresh and leesy, this all-stainless wine has cucumber, apple and green-melon flavors, done in a light tart refreshing style. Drink up.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Another barrel selection, this seems quite thin in comparison with the rest of the winery's 2013s. It's tart and acidic, without the supporting detail and overall elegance of the rest. There are simple fruit flavors of citrus and sour berries.

title: Castel Faglia NV Satén  (Franciacorta)
description: Citrus blossom, white stone fruit and medicinal herb aromas mingle with a whiff of bread crust. The invigorating palate shows Golden Delicious apple and nectarine rind balanced by lively acidity and racy bubbles. It closes on a walnut note.

title: Castellani 2014 Famiglia Castellani  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Red berry, blue flower and clove aromas lift out of the glass along with an earthy whiff of game. The simple palate shows red cherry and a note of cinnamon alongside firm acidity and dusty tannins.

title: Cedar + Salmon 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Lightly floral, this delicate but quite drinkable wine shows flavors of peavine, lime and pineapple. The fruit is just ripe enough, balanced and clean, with refreshing acidity.

title: Château de Callac 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Graves)
description: Superripe Merlot, 60% in this blend, gives this wine power and density, with full-bodied black fruit and firm tannins. Wood aging, partially in new wood, has brought in spice as well as a dry core that indicates the potential of this wine as it matures. Drink from 2023.

title: Domaine Gresser 2015 Kritt Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Mirabelle plum and very ripe pear create a fruity expression on the nose. That same fruit is abundant on the palate. This is a fruity wine with a medium-dry finish.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Subtle notes of yellow plum have an edge of freshness on the nose. The plum notes also pervade on the juicy, fruit-driven palate. This is light easy, dry and refreshing.

title: Fattoria San Felo 2016 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)
description: Aromas of yellow peach, citrus and a whiff of almond carry over to the medium-bodied palate. Fresh acidity gives it a bright finish.

title: Gustave Lorentz 2015 Evidence Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Aromas of pear and lemon rise from the rather neutral nose. The palate comes in with far more fruit in notes of ripe apple and pear, with freshness and a creamy aspect. This is a fruity, easy, dry wine. Drink soon.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Les Natures Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Subdued notes of ripe, yellow pear play on the nose and palate. Freshness balances this beautifully, giving it a dry, crisp finish. Drink soon.

title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Just a hint of cherry appears on the shy nose. On the fresh, light and translucent palate the fruit tone is pure but tart. This is fresh, honest and still has the slightest tannic grip. A very balanced, fresh-faced wine. Drink soon.

title: Koenig Vins Alsace 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose offers a touch of ripe pear. The palate shows less fruit and majors on a neutral but clean and balanced, dry body. This is simple but refreshing. Drink soon.

title: Maryhill 2016 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Sweet herb, lime twist and peach aromas are followed by sleek, narrow citrus and stone-fruit flavors that drink off dry.

title: Melrose 2016 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)
description: Offering classic, varietal fruit flavors of apple and pear, this pleasant wine is lightly spiced and buoyed with supporting acids. It was finished in 5% new French oak.

title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Stinger Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This seems to be quickly drying out, with fruit-leather flavors more than fresh berries and cherries. There's ample acidity and stiff tannins. Best to consume this as soon as possible.

title: Mocali 2015 Mirus  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of Sangiovese, Merlot, Syrah and Alicante, this offers subdued aromas of cassis, cedar and baking spice. The round palate offers black cherry jam and vanilla alongside supple tannins.
